programme.title: A Thief on Titanic
programme.desc: It’s always been a mystery why so many passengers on board Titanic were traveling incognito. Senan Molony uncovers the identity of one secret traveler, who ended up being a thief.

programme.title: Trapped in a Tunnel
programme.desc: Senan Molony digs into the Titanic archives and finds a remarkable story of a greaser - trapped and then rescued from one of the most obscure and forgotten parts of the ship.

programme.title: Ismay Urged More Speed
programme.desc: How involved was Bruce Ismay with the operation of White Star ships at sea? Did he really urge Captain Smith to ignore ice warnings? Senan’s uncovered an account from the Oceanic that suggests Ismay overrode the command of at least one Captain in a...

programme.title: Titanic's Masters at Arms
programme.desc: Titanic had two security officers on board, they were called Master at Arms. Not much is known about their duties but Craig Sopin gives us a rare look into the lives of these two men.

programme.title: Remembering Eva Hart
programme.desc: Charles Haas reflects on his friend, Titanic survivor Eva Hart, in an emotional never before told story of their last encounter and Eva’s surprising change of heart about recovering artifacts.

programme.title: Britannic Dive Part 2
programme.desc: For underwater explorers, the 400-foot dive to Britannic is at the apex of technical diving. Richie Kohler relates his harrowing life and death experience on Britannic in 2009.

programme.title: Titanic's Morse Lamps
programme.desc: Before radio, ships had to communicate with each other visually. During the day they used hand flags and at night it was through morse lamps. Bill Sauder explains Titanic’s Lamps: where they were located and how they were used.

programme.title: Britannic Dive Part 1
programme.desc: Shipwreck explorer, Richie Kohler takes us without a submersible to the warm blue waters of the Aegean Sea and the remarkably preserved HMHS Britannic. Kohler reveals what it’s like to swim freely through the passageways of one of the largest...

programme.title: Titanic's Three Bladed Propeller
programme.desc: Based on a famous 1911 photograph of Olympic in dry dock, it has always been assumed that Titanic had an identical four-bladed center propeller. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside has uncovered a Harland & Wolff document that describes a three-bladed...

programme.title: Should Titanic Have Turned into the Iceberg?
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson takes on the popular controversy that instead of trying to avoid the iceberg, maybe Titanic should have just turned directly into it? Could this have really saved Titanic?

programme.title: Did the Lights Stay On?
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson introduces an eyewitness account who says that the lights stayed on in the aft part of Titanic after she broke! Parks also explains how this could have happened.

programme.title: Was Olympic Retired Too Soon?
programme.desc: Olympic was taken out of service in 1935, after nearly a quarter of a century of a very successful career. Was she retired too soon? It certainly seems there was still plenty of life in her. Mark Chirnside looks at the reasons she was scrapped and why...

programme.title: Watertight Compartments
programme.desc: Can we design a passenger ship that is truly unsinkable? Parks Stephenson looks at that question as it relates to the design and effectiveness of watertight compartments both in 1912 and today.

programme.title: Titanic's First-Class Lounge
programme.desc: What did you do in Titanic’s First Class Lounge? Well oddly enough you didn’t lounge, corsets and celluloid collars prevented that! Bill Sauder gives us a look at what went on inside Titanic’s magnificent lounge for the rich and famous.

programme.title: The Big Four
programme.desc: Celtic, Cedric, Baltic, and Adriatic proceeded the design of Olympic, Titanic, and Britannic. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside reveals why in many ways, they were perhaps the most successful quartet of ships ever built for North Atlantic service.

programme.title: The Padded Room
programme.desc: Hidden away in Titanic’s isolation hospital was a 5x6 room padded completely from top to bottom with canvas cushions. White Star didn’t talk much about the room, but Bill Sauder will tell you how it was used.

programme.title: Rescuing the Telegrams
programme.desc: Charles Haas shares the remarkable story of how priceless pieces of Titanic history were rescued before they were almost lost forever from a dumpster in New York City.

programme.title: The Story Behind the New Titanic Photo
programme.desc: It’s been described as one of the most spectacular photographs of Titanic ever seen. Where did it come from? Andrew Aldridge will give us the backstory behind this remarkable photograph.

programme.title: The Gimbal Lamp
programme.desc: One of the features that really set Titanic apart from other ships was her interior illumination. Titanic Channel Host, Bill Sauder, introduces us to a simple, versatile lamp that was used throughout the ship.

programme.title: Goodbye Old Man
programme.desc: These incredible words written by the most senior surviving officer of the Titanic, gives us a rare and historic glimpse of the final moments of the senior men that night. It may surprise you to hear just how calm these men really were.

programme.title: Archibald Gracie’s Last Letter
programme.desc: Host Andrew Aldridge reveals a remarkable letter written by Archibald Gracie barely eight weeks before he died. It was written to fellow Carpathia passenger Louis Ogden, who was responsible for some of the iconic photographs taken of Titanic survivors...

programme.title: Kicking the Tires
programme.desc: It’s always been debated how much influence Bruce Ismay had on Captain Smith’s operation of the ship on her fateful voyage. Senan Molony gives us a look at a rare photo that may offer some answers.

programme.title: Photographing Titanic
programme.desc: We have so few photographs of Titanic. Collector, Craig Sopin, believes there may be more out there, possibly even in the debris ﬁeld. In this episode, he gives us a rare glimpse of workers photographed on the grand staircase.

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: The Elevator Grills
programme.desc: Ken Marschall continues his series into the remarkable surprises he and James Cameron discovered on their 2001 and 2005 dives to Titanic.

programme.title: Dobbiaco - Cortina Cross Country Race 2022
programme.desc: The beautiful story of the Granfondo Dobbiaco-Cortina began on April 3, 1977, after a heavy snowfall, when a group of friends with a passion for Nordic skiing decided to organize a small race. The fascination of this much loved Nordic ski race derives not only from its evocative Dolomite setting but also from the fact that it unites two Italian mountain territories, two renowned tourist destinations in the heart of the Dolomites, a UNESCO World Natural Heritage Site, two languages, two cultures, two valleys with a shared passion for skiing. And this is the story of its first 45 years of life, a journey connecting the past with the present, featuring breathtaking landscapes and sporting feats. The Dobbiaco Cortina is a race not to be missed, a race that every cross-country skier must do at some point in their career.La lunga storia della Granfondo Dobbiaco Cortina nacque il 3 aprile 1977 dopo una abbondante nevicata, quando un gruppo di amici con la passione per lo sci nordico decisero di organizzare una piccola gara.Una gara di sci nordico che unisce due territori di montagna italiani, due rinomate stazioni turistiche nel cuore delle Dolomiti patrimonio dellUNESCO, due lingue, due culture, due valli con la stessa passione per lo sci. E questa è la storia dei sui 45 anni di vita, un viaggio tra storia e presente, tra panorami mozzafiato e gesta sportive. La Dobbiaco Cortina è una gara da non perdere, che ogni fondista dovrebbe fare nella propria carriera.

programme.title: Krkavka with Vojta Trojan
programme.desc: Pro climber Vojta Trojan climbs and explains the difficulties of some climbing route in the area of Krkavka near Zelezny in Czech Republic. This area has some of the best climbing spots with difficult routes between 6 and 9a. Celebrity Adam Ondra has climbed here several times.

programme.title: Engadin Skimarathon 2025
programme.desc: The Engadin Skimarathon is the second largest cross-country skiing event in the world and the largest cross-country skiing event in Switzerland. Among the large crowd of participants are also world-class runners.

programme.title: Madonna Di Campiglio Clip
programme.desc: Madonna Di Campiglio Clip

programme.title: World Rookie Snowboard Finals 2023
programme.desc: The 2023 World Rookie Finals are took place in Zell am See-Kaprun (Austria), where the world’s best young snowboarders competed in order to take the titles of World Rookie and Grom Snowboard Champions.

programme.title: LAAX OPEN 2025
programme.desc: The LAAX OPEN presented by Zalando brings together the crème de la crème of snowboarding and freeskiing contest riders with the freestyle community. Some of the performances of the professional riders who compete in the FIS World Cups in freeski slopestyle, snowboard slopestyle and snowboard halfpipe are also like something from another realm.

programme.title: Monte Croce Dolomites Winter Hike
programme.desc: Wonderful winter day hike to a WWI bunker and then up to see Yaks - winter furry cows and then to a refuge while enjoying the views of the Dolomites.Magnifique randonnée dune journée dhiver jusquà un bunker de la Première Guerre mondiale, puis jusquà voir des yaks - des vaches à fourrure dhiver, puis jusquà un refuge tout en profitant de la vue sur les Dolomites.

programme.title: Nendaz FWT Challenger 2025
programme.desc: This year, Nendaz Freeride returns to the FWT Challenger, the final stage of the legendary Freeride World Tour, confirming its place among the best freeride competitions. The faces of Mont-Gond offer athletes an infinite number of lines and ideal conditions in which to practice their art. Thats why it attracts so many international freeriders in search of thrills and spills.

programme.title: Tisa with Edita Vopatova
programme.desc: Climbing instructor Edita Vopatova explains the climbing area she nows very well nearby the village of Tisa in the North of Bohemia in Czech Republic. The area is a paradise for climbers with lots of rocks between 20 and 30 meter high. Edita climbs the Heuréka route on a Great Tisa Rock and the Doga Tower.

programme.title: Summiting Mt Sneffels in Colorado (Eng)
programme.desc: Mount Sneffels is a prominent mountain near Ouray, Colorado in the United States which is over 14,000 feet high, more than 4,300 metres. Audree had never climbed a 14er, so we decided to try reach its summit while on a road trip through Colorado in late-July.

programme.title: Engadin Ski Marathon 2024
programme.desc: The Engadin Skimarathon is the second largest cross-country skiing event in the world and the largest cross-country skiing event in Switzerland. Among the large crowd of participants are also world-class runners. Every year, Switzerlands largest sports event attracts more than 11000 cross-country fans from over 67 nations to the Upper Engadin valley.

programme.title: Pierra Menta 2024 #1
programme.desc: La Pierra Menta est devenue au fil des 37 éditions, la compétition de ski-alpinisme de référence, un passage obligé pour l’élite de la discipline. Elle rassemble tous les ans plus de 200 cordées de 2 skieurs. Les français brillent lors de cette première étape de la Pierra Menta Axelle Gachet-Mollaret et Emily Harrop entête, William Bonmardion et Xavier Gachet à laffût. des résultats prometteurs pour la suite de la compétition

programme.title: The First Second - Gediminas Grinius
programme.desc: Running with Gediminas means exploring the mental techniques hes continuously developing to both cope with pain and get on the podiums of the worlds most difficult ultra-trails. Or how a Lithuanian veteran of the Iraq War turned weakness and trauma into personal progress by running with his mind!

programme.title: Trail Menorca Cami De Cavalls 2024
programme.desc: Can you imagine waking up, preparing your backpack, putting on your trainers and running 185 km around the Island of Menorca, with a cumulative elevation gain of 3,500 metres? This is the what awaits you in the Trail Menorca Camí de Cavalls, one of the longest Trail races in Europe and one of the most attractive challenges you can face today. If you prefer you can run shorter distances as there are 5 other races (27, 45, 58, 85 and 100 km)

programme.title: Golden Trail Series - Chasing Dreams Season 2022 - Episode 5 A thirst for victory (Eng)
programme.desc: Follow the GTWS family as they travel together on a dream trip through the U.S. while they stop to race the Pikes Peak Ascent in Colorado and the Flagstaff Sky Peaks in Arizona. Rémi Bonnet, the uphill running specialist, will attempt to break the Manitou Incline record, while some last-minute newcomers might be shaking up the rankings. Take a deep breath and watch the world’s top runners racing at high-altitude.

programme.title: Marathon des Sables Fuerteventura 2024 (Eng)
programme.desc: Welcome to the Fuerteventura Sand Marathon Edition 2024, on the second largest Canary Island off the coast of Africa and theMorocco, land of origin of the MDS. 300 runners from 25 nationalities took on the 3 stages of this course with 3 distances to choose from: 70, 100 or 120km. An extraordinary human adventure in breathtaking landscapes.

programme.title: Salomon Community Run New Caledonia
programme.desc: Salomon Trail Runner Elite Vladimir Shatrov runs on one of the Worlds most challenging and brutal races. The New Caledonia Ultra Trail covers over 130km with 6500 meters of climbs across this stunning terrain. Follow the drama and hard lessons learned in this remote paradise.

programme.title: Canada Man Woman 2023 (Eng)
programme.desc: The Canada Man/Woman XTRI and Solo Point Five are unique long-distance triathlons that test not only physical strength, but also determination and courage. Some might say it’s too risky, too cold, even dangerous to take on this challenge… we think it’s a wonderful opportunity to surpass yourself and discover your true abilities!

programme.title: Garmin instrumentation on board Zar Imagine 130
programme.desc: Hop on the Zar 130 Imagine and discover Garmins on-board instrumentation. The pleasure of sailing is combined with the joy of using a technology that is both advanced and easy to use.

programme.title: Renier R11 - The essence of yachting
programme.desc: Discover a high-level boat, free from frills and excesses, with an automotive-inspired design. The maneuverability is excellent and the speed in changing course is fantastic. Get on board!

programme.title: Chris Craft 35 Calipso - Palm Beach 2023
programme.desc: Chris Craft 35 Calipso celebrated for their intricate design, details, high quality craftsmanship and style. Hop on board their new Chris Craft 35 Calipso.

programme.title: Dynamic D305V - Smooth performance, smoothly stylish
programme.desc: Dynamic D305V is one of the bests in the game by its slim and narrow model that serves active trimming of the water ever so smoothly.

programme.title: Salpa Soleil 24.5 – Adrenaline Rush
programme.desc: Bacci Del Buono tries the new Salpa Soleil 24.5, proving the boat’s excellency in navigation and performance yet still maintaining comfort.

programme.title: In the name of greatness
programme.desc: The Ferretti 1000 is the latest milestone reached by Ferretti Yachts and is the largest boat ever built by the yard. The name reflects the concept of grandeur according to which it was conceived and designed.

programme.title: Grand Banks 85 - A peculiar hull
programme.desc: Justin Ratcliffe is in Cannes on board the Grand Banks 85, the new flagship of the Grand Banks fleet. This boat has a very innovative hull, that is the result of the research on performance and fuel efficiency conducted by the company.

programme.title: WallyWhy200 - A revolutionary yacht
programme.desc: Our Antonio Vettese brings you on board the revolutionary WallyWhy200, an ultra-luxury yacht that will blow your mind. This model is innovative in many aspects, one of them is the ground-breaking owner’s suite at the bow, where the hull has been thoroughly studied to ensure that silence and comfort are preserved, even at maximum speed.

programme.title: Cruiser Yachts 46 Cantius - Annapolis Boat Show 2022
programme.desc: Hop on board the Cruiser Yachts 46 Cantius, an incredible superyacht that will blow your mind and an exclusive interview with Perry Avery, from Marine Max.

programme.title: Viking - Range - FLIBS 2024
programme.desc: Bill Hackett takes you to the Fort Lauderdale Boat Show to discover the Viking Yachts range.

programme.title: Itama 62 RS - Class and sportiness
programme.desc: Itama has a great knowledge of the sea and boats, so it is no wonder that the boats produced are timeless, just like the Itama 62 RS. Discover this elegant and sporty model and its incredible hull.

programme.desc: Are you ready to get a unique on-board experience with the brand-new performance yacht Pershing GTX 116? Follow Maurizio Bulleri as he walks through the speed yacht lovers’ potential suitor.

programme.title: Sanlorenzo SP110 - FLIBS 2022
programme.desc: Displayed at the Fort Lauderdale’s Boat Show was the Sanlorenzo SP110. This model belongs to a new series that embodies the concept of lightness and also a new approach to design.

programme.title: OTAM 58 GTS - Exclusivity and power
programme.desc: The Boat Show is in Cannes to discover the OTAM 58 GTS, an incredible performance yacht built by the iconic shipyard Otam, which realises unique models for customers who value construction processes, materials, technology and assembly methods.

programme.title: Riva 76 Bahamas Super - Open or Coupé (Eng)
programme.desc: Exclusive test of the Riva 76 Bahamas Super, the new born from the famous Riva shipyard. Hop on board and discover all about it!

programme.title: Mangusta Oceano 50 - Flibs 2022
programme.desc: The Boat Show is in Ft. Lauderdale on board the Mangusta Oceano 50, built with the idea of a big beach club and great design.

programme.title: Xenta - X-Aid
programme.desc: Review of the new Xenta X-Aid, an innovative and fully integrated boat control system, mounted on board Ferretti 670. Discover it Maurizio Bulleri.

programme.title: Prestige F4 - Absolute novelty
programme.desc: Hop on board the Prestige F4, a flying bridge motor yacht built in France by Prestige, a brand of Beneteau Group.

programme.title: A special super yacht
programme.desc: This Benetti Fast Lejos 125 is one of the leading boats in the mega-yacht market, thanks to its excellent performance. Take look at the propulsion system is by Rolls Royce… but it is not over! Keep watching and check out the performance…

programme.title: Tankoa Solo - A nautical masterpiece
programme.desc: The Boat Show offers you a special seat to discover magnificent vessels, inside and out. That’s the turn of the Tankoa Solo, a superyacht with a long story and was built with the only goal to be perfect in every way. Discover all the work behind this Italian masterpiece.

programme.title: Everyday Black Man
programme.desc: Since closing the door to a violent past, quiet and thoughtful Moses Stanton everyday existence is running a small neighborhood store, and watching over his daughter who doesnt know he exists. When a young man, Malik, comes in claiming to be a black Muslim that is doing good for the neighborhood, Moses takes him on as a partner but soon realizes that Malik is nothing but a drug dealer seeking to destroy the neighborhood and Mosess daughter. Therefore, Moses must become the man he used to be in order to save his beloved neighborhood and his daughter.

programme.title: Cloud9 and Top Esports SIX GAME WIN STREAKS, T1 Close to Breaking Its Own Record, sadlions.jpg
programme.desc: There is only one true king in the LPL: Chaos. EDG, LNG, and Weibo all suffered huge losses this week as RNG climb up the standings. And after six straight wins, Top Esports look like theyre recapturing their 2020 form. programme.title: What to do in Pompano Beach
programme.desc: One of South Florida’s hidden gems is Pompano Beach, Florida. Located just north of Fort Lauderdale, this quiet beach town is perfect for those who prefer less crowds and a laid back atmosphere. It’s ideal location makes access to other South Florida towns, including Miami, super easy. I start my journey at the Fort Lauderdale Marriott Pompano Beach Resort & Spa. It has the most amazing sunrises which I delighted in each day from my private balcony. The hotel is located directly on the beach which makes it very difficult to leave. I visit the charming beachside town of Lauderdale by the Sea, a 10 minute drive from my hotel. I also take a tour at Butterfly World, the first and largest butterfly house in the United States. It is home over 80 species of butterflies, hummingbird and lorikeet aviaries, and outdoor gardens. This place is truly magical for people of all ages. Pompano Beach is the quintessential beach town. You can truly relax and enjoy the beach at your own pace while indulging as much or as little as you’d like.

programme.title: Seoul
programme.desc: South Korea has been making waves on a global scale. Across Asia and the rest of the world, this capital city is a pulsating force in pop-culture and beauty. Like its denizens - well-dressed, confident, and proud - this influential city pushes the new frontiers while honoring its 2,000 year old heritage. Emerging as one of Asia’s tastemaker-cultures, Seoul births new trends in foods, fashion, beauty, technology, and entertainment. From 24hr shopping in Dongdaemun, hanging in HongDae, strolling down Garosugil, or drowning yourself in the different party scenes that define Itaewon and Gangnam’s nightlife, Seoul is trendy, vibrant, and engaging. While each neighborhood has its own distinction, Seoul pours out its love generously to all of its residents and visitors with each sip of soju or bite of kimchi. Whether you come for the food, the people, or the party, trust us, you’ll feel like you’re the underdog as the city test your limits. We love Seoul.

programme.title: Mrs. Pound
programme.desc: Dont judge a book by its cover, this is not your average stamp shop. Inspired by a fictional story of secret lovers, Mrs. Pound brings to life the story of a former 1950s Shanghai burlesque dancer, her married lover (Mr. Ming) and their elaborate clandestine rendezvous space. Offering a new twist on asian fusion cuisine, the 45 seat venue features a lower dining room (Mrs. Pound), an upper dining room (Mr . Ming), and a bar area at which these two spaces merge. Mixed with plush velvet banquettes, vintage tiles, neon artwork, suspended mirrored marquee lights with lipstick messages, and a 1960s style showgirl glamour, Mrs. Pounds creative interior sets the tone for a unique and entertaining culinary (and drinking) experience. We like the Hainanese Chicken Rice, Thai Milk Tea Cake, Sriracha Street Corn, and Lemongrass Pork Chop. Although it will be a longer wait, do yourself a favor and go for dinner for the best experience.

programme.title: Sak Yant Tattoo
programme.desc: Traditional hand needle tattoos have been a staple of Thai culture for centuries with the common practitioners being Buddhist monks. Why? The spiritual significance and meanings behind the permanent body art are manifestations of the individual’s aura. Ajarn Noo, a former Buddhist monk turned spiritual Thai tattoo master, has gained international recognition since tattooing Angelina Jolie and consequently many other celebrities like Michele Rodriguez and David Beckham. His tattoo parlor is unlike any you’ve ever been to because he performs the spiritual practice in the sanctuary of his own home. Walk past the larger than life statues devoted to Buddha, up the stairs and into the top floor of his residence There you will find photos adorning his walls of countless celebrities, the royal family and others who have come before you. You can than evaluate your various options but here is the kicker – there is no guarantee you will get the tattoo you are looking for. You must first stand before Ajarn Noo for a spiritual evaluation and based on each individual’s aura, Ajarn Noo will either approve and customize a tattoo for you based on your own spirit or send you packing. So come with a clear heart, a clear mind and let your inner soul speak to Ajarn in hopes of a tattoo blessing that will be unlike any other.

programme.title: Li Qun Duck
programme.desc: Zhang Li Qun welcomes you to his home to experience this classic delicacy. And when we say classic, we mean the ultimate classic. Throughout the years, there have been many spins on Peking Duck, even in Beijing. However, Li Qun Duck roasts their duck in accordance with the Qing Imperial Kitchen and their production methods, including the traditional hanging furnace technique. In a very proud city rich with historical heritage, this is about as local as it gets. Tucked away in the winding hutongs of the Qianmen area, do not miss this hidden gem….you will savor this taste of old Beijing for eternity.

programme.title: Balloon trip gives passengers a real bird’s eye view of the desert
programme.desc: Ballooning is the earliest form of human flight. In 18th century France, King Louis XVI and Marie Antoinette watched as the first passengers - a duck, a rooster and a sheep - took off in one from Versailles . These days it’s a big attraction for tourists the world over. But in Dubai, hot air ballooning comes with a twist. You can fly with a peregrine falcon. Falconer Dylan Freeman says its the only place in the world where you can fly with the fastest animal on the planet. “What were trying to simulate here is having the falcon soaring. “Theyve been recorded reaching speeds of 389 km/h in a dive. From one kilometre up he can see a pigeon four kilometres away. So then he would fly above it, fold up his wings, and dive down really quickly to try and catch it.” Peter Kollar, co-founder and chief pilot of Balloon Adventures Dubai , says dawn is a good time to take to the skies. “Its a beautiful area because its a mix of desert, pristine desert …… and there are green oases in the desert, which gives a beautiful contrast.” Kollar says the route the balloon takes is very much up to the weather. “Eighty per cent of my work is meteorology. If we get the weather right my job is relatively simple. Really ballooning is true flying because you have to use Mother Nature.”

programme.title: Tulum
programme.desc: At its core Tulum is a vibrant mix of extremely old and extremely new. Prehistoric natural wonders and ancient Mayan ruins are scattered among world-class resorts slinging more fresh lobster and mezcal than the human body is probably meant to consume. Long known for its yoga retreats and rustic eco-hotels, the off-the-grid Tulum of 15 years ago is still there, but it now exists alongside thrumming nightlife and unparalleled culinary adventures. Chefs and mixologists from around the globe have been lured to Tulum by its beachside DGAF vibe and a willingness to rewrite the rules. There are plenty of destination-worthy bars and clubs near the city’s central Hotel Zone, but if you want to escape the glitz—or maybe civilization itself—plunge into one of the region’s underground swimming caves formed millions of years ago, believed by Mayans to be a passage to another dimension. With breathtaking beaches, history you can touch, and a unique kind of artistic-inspired luxury, Tulum is whatever you want it to be. Oh, and there are lots of tequila and tacos, too. Do take advantage of that.

programme.title: From screen to plate: the MasterChef restaurant goes live
programme.desc: Its the most successful cookery television format in the world having been adapted in 52 countries and viewed by over 250 million people worldwide. Now the MasterChef TV Experience is going from screen to plate with a new restaurant in Dubai. Its a world first, and Euronews Jane Witherspoon went to check it out. Shaun O’Neale was champion of MasterChef US Season 7 . He says the contest was one of the most stressful and hardest things hes ever done. "Youve got Gordon Ramsay screaming down your throat if youre not doing something right. But, it was the most rewarding thing, the most fulfilling thing. It really showed me my true passion and my true love for food. So its about time for people to come in and experience and get a taste of that mystery box." Now Sean and other MasterChef champions will be in residency at the MasterChef TV Experience - where they will also compose their own personal menus. Running the show In charge of the kitchen, the restaurants Head Chef, Margarita Vaamonde-Beggs. She says the MasterChef brand is a perfect fit for a restaurant - and for Dubai. "I believe that we stand out for us because we have already a huge fan base. In the Dubai market, it’s a city of foodies and it means something to so many people around the world." The Mystery Box One highlight on the menu is based on the shows Mystery Box challenge. Guests choose secret ingredients from the box and chefs have 35 minutes to create an original dish. And thats the dish Euronews wants. Today the Mystery Box ingredients include black garlic, Jerusalem artichokes, fresh oregano and a variety of mushrooms. They look delicious but will barely more than half-an-hour be enough time to turn them into a meal? Chef Margarita isnt worried: "We are going to be on time. Its going to be fine." It gets down to wire but 35 minutes later, with not a second to spare, Chef Margarita has produced a mouth-watering stuffed raviolo, covered with chocolate and black garlic. Not only does it taste amazing,

programme.title: Animal conservation "a government priority" says United Arab Emirates
programme.desc: Dubai and the United Arab Emirates are making animal conservation a government priority at a time when biodiversity is under threat and more animals face extinction globally. A report by the United Nations earlier this year claimed animal extinctions are at an unprecedented high. According to the organisation, as many as one million species are under threat. On a visit to the desert, you might expect to find camels or antelope, maybe some hawks. But Dubai’s Al Marmoom animal sanctuary is teeming with biodiversity with hundreds of different species of birds, mammals, and reptiles. The sanctuary covers 20 percent of the whole area of Dubai. In the beginning, it was a desert populated by native animals, but as the sanctuary expanded to more than 50 oases, it was discovered these water bodies could control the environmental balance. The sanctuary has even managed to attract the Arabian Oryx. This animal was declared extinct in the wild in 1972, but has now been brought back from the brink by the reserve. Saoud Faisal is a wildlife officer at the Al Marmoom sanctuary. He says in the 80s and 90s the Oryx were overhunted for food. Now the animal is considered part of the regions wildlife. “They are totally protected now and also they are healthy,” he explains. “We have them in large numbers which last year reached more than 500." From desert oases to indoor tropical environments, recent laws in Dubai mean greater governmental support for animal sanctuaries. Laws were introduced in 2007 to cover animal welfare, but awareness really started to build in 2016. The laws also apply to rare and exotic animals. Some are looked after in animal sanctuaries like Green Planet. Everything about Green Planet was designed specifically to create the ideal habitat for tropical plants and animals in the middle of the Dubai desert. The sanctuary houses a wide range of species including many different birds, and mammals such as two-toed sloths. And lizards like green iguanas or basilisks. The latest addition t

programme.title: Best Cafes to Fuel Up in NYC
programme.desc: Breakfast sandwiches, coffee, burgers, fries, sandwiches, and beer - Jimmy Phillips lists top cafes in NYC to refuel before or after a bike ride.

programme.title: Shanghai Me - A taste of 1930's China
programme.desc: A favourite for Royalty, celebrities and sports stars, Shanghai Me transports its guests back in time to pre-war China. Taste finds out why this fine-dining restaurant has been voted one of the best in the gulf region. Shanghai in the 1930s was called the Paris of the East. One restaurant that’s capturing that flavour is Shanghai Me in Dubai’s financial district. Exuding the atmosphere the Orient, this establishment offers a unique dining experience. Euronews Evan Bourke paid a visit to meet Head Chef Shane Macneill, who cooked one of the restaurants signature dishes, black cod. Click on the video link above to watch the full episode.

programme.desc: Spring is in the air, and were ready for our next travel adventure! Check out this video featuring Lonely Planet Magazines Top Springtime Destinations around the globe!

programme.desc: Well show you where to stay & what to do in New York & Chicago for St. Patricks Day. You dont need the luck of the Irish, you need TravelSavvy.tv!

programme.title: St. Croix Part I - Beach & Shopping
programme.desc: Teri and Andrea journey to St. Croix to explore Turtle Beach on Buck Island, then taste local cuisine at LaReines Chicken Shack, then go shopping in Christansted at Shays Boutique and My Girlfriends Closet.

programme.title: A quintessential quarantine dish
programme.desc: With the world still in lockdown to combat the coronavirus, delicious food is a topic everyone can rally around. Euronews met up with Chef Othman Reif at his Japanese restaurant in Dubai, Kushiyaki, to taste one of his signature dishes. "You’re going to get a piece of Wagyu, thin cut. And we’re going to brush with a little bit of the wagyu fat. Just sear on the one side. Have a little bit of fun you know what I mean. It’s simple, easy you know, no hassle." Click on the video link above to see how its done. ​

programme.title: Local Food in Puerto Vallarta
programme.desc: Teri explores the local food scene in Puerto Vallarta via a food tour where she eats tacos birria style with meat marinated in goats head, samples the cerviche at Gueros and learns how to drink tequila bandera style.

programme.title: Jilsiru Tteok Cafe
programme.desc: At first blush, the Jilsiru Tteok Cafe may strike more adventurous explorers as a bit of a snoozefest. Its a cafe attached to an actual Tteok museum (koreans take their rice cakes seriously) inside the old, traditional Insadong neighborhood. Nothing new or trendy but its actually one of those places that you may find yourself wandering back into after your initial bad attitude. The first floor houses the Tteok Cafe where one can essentially purchase and eat every variety of Tteok known to mankind pretty much. The textures and fillings are as varied as the many colors that are on display and its easy to mindlessly go into a tteok-frenzy but it pays to be selective because theres only so much glutinous rice hunks one can eat in one sitting and tteok is known to go stale quickly.When youve had your fill of colorful starch, head up to the 2nd floor where you can find the museum part of the experience and learn about the thousands of years of tteok history. And if youre wanting a little more action after, head on over to the traditional Korean Liquor Museum which is in the same building.In total, this place really is a hub for Koreas days of yore, including spreads on North Korean cuisine and what emperors have been served . Just make sure you come brave enough to try the dried manta ray.

programme.title: The Ice Music Festival: Music You Have to See to Believe
programme.desc: The Ice Music Festival on the Holmevatnet Islands in Norway is exactly what the name suggests: Ice music. As in, the cellos and harps and horns are made from lake ice. Yes, they work. Just listen.

programme.title: Issaya
programme.desc: The dining room is a daring mix of classic and modern furniture on terracotta tile floors with unusually colourful wallpapers. The whole room basks in a very soft light and the result works surprising well. The menu, both in Thai and English, is not illustrated but cleverly written, keeping the phonetic dish names instead of an elaborated but hard to visualize description. The wine list is substantial and several excellent wines are available by the glass.

programme.title: Cuba: 50 Years After the Revolution
programme.desc: A writer returns to Cuba 50 years after its revolution to track down his familys long-lost tobacco estate using only black-and-white photos as reference.

programme.title: Kanda Myojin
programme.desc: Located in Chiyoda, this Shinto shrine has been watching over the neighborhoods of Kanda, Nihonbashi, Akihabara, Ootemachi, Marunouchi and others since the 14th century. Although the Gate of God suffered the fires, earthquakes and wars over the years, the rebuilt pavilion — decked out in stunning vermillion and gold with lacquered interiors — still attracts worshipers and visitors alike. Like the Kanda area itself, the shrine celebrates its history but also looks to the future. On any given day, you’ll find a mix of businessmen praying to the gods for luck and prosperity, young brides wishing for a good marriage, and others simply trying to ward of bad vibes. But the shrine’s priests started reaching out to younger generations with anime characters and charms that look like SD cards. Every other May, the shrine becomes a centerpiece for Kanda Matsuri, one of Tokyo’s most famous festivals since the Edo period. Locals parade with their favorite deities, or kami, through the neighborhoods, making their way to the shrine for the ultimate bash. If you think you have a samurai spirit, this should feel like home.

programme.title: Mother's Day Gift Guide: Travel Gifts
programme.desc: Mother’s Day is just around the corner, so weve rounded up a few excellent gifts shell love. From fab fashion to beautiful art, join us as we reveal some of our favorite things.

programme.title: The biodiversity of Dubai's shores has brought fly fishing to the Middle East for the first time
programme.desc: When most people think of fly fishing they think of being far out in the wilderness, away from civilisation, by a river or somewhere in the ocean. But Ocean Active Fly has re-imagined this scene - offering urban fly fishing right in the middle of Dubai. This is the first fly fishing operation in the Middle East. The founder, Nick Bowles, explained to Euronews why fishing there are fishing opportunities in Dubai: "Dubai’s built the biggest man-made reefs with the palm islands and that, so it’s created a huge habitat." Artificial reefs can lead to a quick increase in the local fish population. They draw plankton which smaller fish can prey on which then attracts bigger fish suitable for fly fishing. One species drawn to the artificial reefs in Dubai is the queenfish. They can grow to be over a metre long and up to 15 kilograms, although most are about half that weight. This kind of fish is particularly good for fly fishing because of its visual takes and the fact it swims in schools. Fly fishing differs from more conventional spin fishing. Instead of having a heavy lure at the end of the fishing line, fly fishers have a fly which is lighter and less likely to scare away game. The fly stays on the surface of the water where fish will be attracted to it, thinking it is prey. With ocean fly fishing youre constantly on the move to find the next school of fish "So you literally run - shoot, run - shoot." But the unique part of fly fishing in Dubai is the proximity to its skyline. Fly fishing is done close to the shore so anglers are surrounded by the citys landmarks.: the Burj Khalifa, the Burj Al Arab, Palm Jumeirah and Dubai Marina.

programme.title: Dubai Creek: Discover a lost Arabian world
programme.desc: Dubai Creek flows through the Emirates historic heart. For just one dirham, abra rides provide boatloads of nostalgia while travelling between the souks and museums of Deira and Bur Dubai. These heritage hubs recall the Bedouins’ humble and ancient past built on pearls, and then shaped by a free trade boom that brought new settlers to the creek in the early 1900’s. Echoing that era, today’s expats – some descendants of those early traders – share authentic flavours from their homelands in a culinary kaleidoscope that compliments Emirati fare. Popular food tours Food tours are a popular way to explore Dubai Creek. Arva Ahmed is the founder of Frying Pan Adventures. She describes one of the restaurants that features on the tours itinerary. "One of the restaurants we stop on our tour is called Sultan Dubai Falafel," she says. "And the thing that they are known for is stuffed falafels. They stuff them with chilli, onion and sumac. These falafels are the most juiciest most filled with herbs and fragrant falafels that you’re going to find in the city." Deira’s Waterfront market is piled high with technicolour fruit and vegetables and stacks of shellfish with legs choreographed in chorus-line unison. Here you can buy the catch of the day and have it cooked in many different ways for old-school Creekside dining. Ras Al Khor Wildlife Sanctuary Until recently, the creek ended at Ras Al Khor Wildlife Sanctuary. Here nature lovers can spot flamingos that migrate to the Sanctuary, a wetland extension of the creek spread over 6.2 sq.km. It features a variety of mangroves and lagoons perfect for migrating birds - the sanctuary is home to over 180 species of birds. Following its expansion as Dubai Canal, the creek curves past book-shaped Mohammed Bin Rashid Library, high-rise Business Bay and beach-hugging Jumeirah before it’s reunited with its source - the glittering Arabian Gulf.

Harvey shares whats it like to be a powerhouse in the entertainment industry...despite overcoming a few hardships. Then, we go one-on-one with music producer & So So Def Recordings CEO, Jermaine Dupri who is best known for producing for Janet Jackson and Mariah Carey–talks about his longevity in the music industry. And finally, our panel discussion explores whether Reality TV is a right fit for your brand with two savvy entrepreneurs: Kim Kimble and Egypt Sherrod.

programme.title: Journey Through Alaska

programme.title: Death Valley & Mono Lake - New Extended Version!
programme.desc: Experience the dramatic beauty of Death Valley, from sunrise over the sand dunes to the colorful formations of Zabriske point. Explore the unique limestone formations known as "tufa towers", the amazing bird life, and relaxing serenity of Mono Lake, an inland sea at the base of the Sierra Mountains. Bonus footage of the geothermal "hot creek" in the Sierras. This film is newly extended with awe-inspiring footage of the nesting Ospreys and aerial views of Mono Lake!

programme.title: Preview for "Journey Through the Dolomites"
programme.desc: This is a preview of the 90 minute "Journey through the Dolomites". Experience the spectacular Dolomites mountain range in Italy: dramatic stone spires, vast alpine meadows, charming villages, and brilliant blue lakes. The full film is available to subscribers of NatureStream.tv.

programme.title: Preview of Framed Matted Art Displays
programme.desc: This is a preview of a series of 15 of Elizabeth Carmels Fine Art Photographs matted like framed art pieces.The full 2 1/2 hour film displays each photograph for 10 minutes. To remain on one photograph press pause, follow the directions in our video "Displaying Fine Art Photographs on Your Apple TV and Roku. This display is shown on a Samsung Frame TV with a Burlwood Frame available at www.TheCarmelGallery.com

programme.title: Preview for "Autumn Exhilaration" 2 Hour Nature Film
programme.desc: Available on October 30th, 2021 -The exhilaration of autumn in the Colorado Rockies and High Sierras awaits you in our latest film release! Soar over the brilliant aspen forests of Colorado, immerse yourself in the glowing autumn leaves, and bask in the golden light of sunrise on the high mountain peaks. The inspiring scenery is accompanied by a soothing ambient music soundtrack. Available to subscribers of NatureStream.tv. Runtime 2.5 Hours.

programme.title: Nature's Abstracts
programme.desc: This 2 hour moving art film immerses you in the wondrous abstract patterns found in nature through the fine art photography of Elizabeth Carmel.

programme.title: Cameron Vs. Justin & Jessica
programme.desc: S1:E13 Cameron Diaz was one of the biggest stars in the world. So why did she leave it all behind? Our team uncovers a link between Cameron’s explosive breakup with Justin Timberlake and her choice to leave acting behind. It all ties back to one question, did Justin cheat on Cameron?Justin sparked cheating rumors when he moved on from Cameron 4 days later with Jessica Biel. Our team gets to the truth behind those rumors to reveal the role Justin played in Cameron disappearing and the truth is even more shocking…

programme.title: Drake Vs. Kanye West
programme.desc: S1:E16 Drake went from hip hop hero to deadbeat dad when Kanye West collaborator Pusha T revealed Drake was hiding a secret son, but why was he hiding his son in the first place? And how did Pusha know about it?Everybody assumed Kanye had leaked the information because he was threatened by Drake’s success, but the truth is way more complicated.After digging into Drake and Kanye’s feud and friendship, our team discovered the real story behind Drake’s secret son and the journey he went on to embrace fatherhood for himself.

programme.title: Drake Bell vs. Josh Peck
programme.desc: S1:E15 Everyone loved Drake & Josh but people don’t know the dark story behind the world’s favorite kids’ show. Josh struggled with his weight and addiction while filming the show. It was always painful for him to be the chubby sidekick to the cool, popular Drake. Then Josh shocked the world when he revealed that he and Drake weren’t even really friends. Drake was furious, sparking a massive backlash against Josh. But no one knew just how dark of a path Drake had gone down.

programme.title: Justin Bieber Vs. Hailey Bieber
programme.desc: S2:E7 Justin and Hailey Bieber are at the height of their careers. So why do they keep getting sick? Our team uncovers this isn’t the first time one of Justin’s love interests has had a life-threatening illness. It all ties back to one question, did Justin cheat on Selena Gomez with Hailey?

programme.title: Anna Faris vs. Chris Pratt
programme.desc: S1:E6 If Chris Pratt didn’t have an affair with Jennifer Lawrence, why did he file for divorce From Anna Faris? Chris Pratt and Anna Faris were the famous, ideal couple the world couldn’t get enough of. But when Chris Pratt skyrocketed into superstardom, Anna felt more and more insecure. Then, rumors of Chris having an affair with co-star Jennifer Lawrence emerged. Even though they both deny having an affair, Chris and Annas sudden divorce, fallout of their personal lives, and the health of their son caused a media frenzy that our team got to the bottom of.

programme.title: Cameron Vs. Justin & Jessica
programme.desc: S1:E13 Cameron Diaz was one of the biggest stars in the world. So why did she leave it all behind? Our team uncovers a link between Cameron’s explosive breakup with Justin Timberlake and her choice to leave acting behind. It all ties back to one question, did Justin cheat on Cameron?Justin sparked cheating rumors when he moved on from Cameron 4 days later with Jessica Biel. Our team gets to the truth behind those rumors to reveal the role Justin played in Cameron disappearing and the truth is even more shocking…

programme.title: The Rise of Frank Shamrock
programme.desc: S1:E2 Frank Shamrock was one of the toughest fighters to ever compete in the UFC. He holds the world record for the fastest consecutive knockouts, but his biggest fight happened when he was a child, living with his stepfather. His stepfather emotionally abused him so devastatingly, that even when Frank was sent to a Juvenile Detention Center, the other kids couldn’t believe what he went through. While many kids would be crushed under such pain and suffering, Frank Shamrock was determined to prove why warriors always find a way to win.

programme.title: The Rise of Wim Hof
programme.desc: S1:E1 The Iceman (Wim Hof), a man seemingly immune to freezing temperatures, who once climbed Mount Everest only in his shorts and shoes sounds like a fictional superhero. But Wim isn’t invincible to pain, in fact, the opposite. The worst tragedy he’s suffered was the catalyst that inspired him to master his mind and body and help millions do the same.

programme.title: The Rise of Charity Witt
programme.desc: S1:E5 Dubbed The Worlds Strongest Barbie, Charity suffered a heart attack when she was only 17 years old, due to being overworked and poor life choices. This health crisis lead her to change her mindset by taking action on changing her life, that put her on a path that lead her to becoming an elite powerlifter, a Strongwoman competitor, a winner of the Titan Games and escaping an abusive relationship.

programme.title: The Rise Of Damien Rider
programme.desc: S1:E7 Damien Rider was beaten up, thrown against walls, and left all by himself as a child because of an abusive stepfather. After four attempts to end his own life, he decided he needed to deal with his demons by doing the most extreme thing he could do. Discover why Damien felt like he needed to paddle through a deadly ocean and why when he was just about to quit, the entire trajectory of his life would be permanently changed forever.

programme.title: Muggsy Bogues: A Giant On The Court
programme.desc: Muggsy Bogues is the shortest man in NBA history at only 5 ft 3. He’s also one of the best basketball players of all time. Coming from a rough neighbourhood where he was shot at by the age of 5, no one believed in him. He was bullied and mocked because of his height, yet today, he’s got some of the best basketball dunks ever seen. Now, everyone wonders: hows that possible? How did he even make it to the NBA? This is Muggsy’s story: a true underdog who had all the odds against him.

programme.title: Real Stories With Wim Hof
programme.desc: In this bonus exclusive Goalcast interview, find out what Wim Hofs mother said to him at a very young age that drives every move he makes. Wim Hof is a world record breaker and a global phenomenon. He is famous for his superhuman ability to perform extreme long-distance swimming under freezing water. But the Iceman believes he has a special calling in the world.

programme.title: Linda Cliatt-Wayman: A Teacher Like No Other
programme.desc: Linda Cliatt-Wayman volunteered to be Principal of one of the most dangerous schools in America. On her first day, she quickly realized that the job was much more complex and frightening than she thought. But, she was determined to give her students hope, even when they were threatening her life.

programme.title: Bre Lasley: Uninvited Guest
programme.desc: Bre & Kayli Lasley called 911 four times as they fought for their lives against an ex-con who broke into their home, but the police never arrived. How did Bre survive this terrifying home invasion? And what happened to her younger sister, Kayli?

programme.title: Mike Tyson: The Baddest Man On The Planet
programme.desc: Mike Tyson was called the “baddest man on earth;” but outside the ring, family tragedy & childhood trauma were causing him to spiral out of control. Learn how Tyson found discovered what it really means to be a winner.

programme.title: Ramla Ali: Blow by Blow - A Life in the Ring
programme.desc: After her brother died in the Somali Civil War, Ramla Ali and her family fled to the UK in hopes of a better life. But things werent easy for the young Somali... Ramla stood out and was bullied because she was overweight and from a different culture. When her mother bought her a gym membership in order to build her confidence, Ramla tried out a boxing class and fell in love with the sport. A move that would change her life forever.

programme.title: Deontay Wilder - Box For Life
programme.desc: American heavyweight champion Deontay Wilder reveals the heartbreaking reason why he got into boxing and the one person who inspired him to never give up fighting to become the World Champion.

programme.title: Saroo Brierley: Journey Back Home
programme.desc: 5-year-old Saroo Brierley woke up on a train heading 2,000km away from his home in India & thought he’d never see his family again. Accidentally orphaned, an Australian family adopted him but Saroo couldn’t let go of the thought that his family mighty still be alive. 25 years later, he embarked on a quest to find the truth and what happens next is truly unbelievable.

programme.title: Jennifer Asberson: When Rejection Turns Deadly
programme.desc: On September 27, 1992, 19 year old Jennifer Asbenson accepts a ride from a stranger after missing her bus to work. When the man asks for her number, she gives him a fake one to be safe and forgets about it, unaware that she has just refused the advances of a deranged serial killer. At the end of her shift that morning, she does not make it back home. Jennifer escapes twice, yet no one believes what has happened to her. 5 years later, his arrest would reveal the most shocking information.

programme.title: Christine Ha: Courage in the Kitchen
programme.desc: In this exclusive Goalcast Original, the first blind contestant and winner of MasterChef, Christine Ha, opens up about how she lost her sight and her mother at a young age. These formative experiences shaped who she is today and pushed her to never give up on her dreams and finding ways to connect with the spirit of her mother.

programme.title: This is What a Real $3.2M Retirement Portfolio Looks Like
programme.desc: Have you ever found yourself at a crossroads, wondering how to determine the perfect mix for your retirement portfolio? The questions can be overwhelming. What stocks should I own? What bonds should be in my portfolio? Where should I allocate them? In this video I walk through a real-life example to shed light on the steps taken to guide one couple through this intricate process. Meet Todd and Katie Todd, 66, and Katie, 63, approached us with a $3.2 million portfolio, seeking guidance on allocation. Despite diligent saving and investing, they felt uncertain about their financial security in retirement.

programme.title: NEW 2025 Rules For Working And Receiving Social Security
programme.desc: "Are you collecting Social Security benefits while still working? For some, this can be a smooth process, but for others, it may lead to unexpected reductions or penalties. In this video, Marvin Musick will explain how working while receiving Social Security can impact your benefits and what you need to watch out for to avoid potential issues."

programme.title: Turning 65? Why I Would NOT Take Social Security!
programme.desc: Are you nearing 65 and thinking over Social Security benefits? Before you make that crucial decision, join Marvin Musick from Medicare School. He will walk you through the ins and outs of Social Security as you are turning 65! Were diving deep into the nitty-gritty of Social Security benefits. Did you know the timing of your benefits can significantly impact your financial future? Whether youre considering early retirement at 62 or delaying till 70, Ive got the lowdown on how each choice affects your pocket. Well calculate together, step-by-step, to find out your full retirement age and how this magic number transforms your benefits. But wait, theres more! Its not just about numbers; its about strategy and longevity. Marvin is going to share with you FIVE real-life scenarios where waiting on Social Security could be your golden ticket. Think you know it all about Social Security? Think again! Marvin is going to give you tips that could change the way you view your retirement planning.

programme.title: How to Bait a Shark
programme.desc: "In this episode, host Bharat Kanodia will show us how to bait a Shark, tell us what a senior living home is worth, and what a auto repair shop is worth."

programme.title: Podcasts
programme.desc: "In this episode, host Bharat Kanodia takes us on a journey to learn more about podcasts and what an online business is worth."

programme.title: The New Retirement Strategy That's Changing the Game
programme.desc: In the world of financial planning, theres one thing that often gets overlooked. Retirement is not just about investments and numbers; its about embracing lifes joys and purposes.

programme.title: The Earliest and Saefest Time to Stop Saving for Retirement
programme.desc: Investing for the future is a commendable and necessary goal for financial security, especially in retirement. However, there comes a point when continuing to save may have diminishing returns, sacrificing current experiences for a future that might be overly secured. In this blog post, well delve into a real client case study and explore the principles of compounding and opportunity cost that led to a surprising recommendation: to stop saving for retirement.

programme.title: Comparing Advantage VS Supplemental COST on $200k Hospital Stay __
programme.desc: "Over half of retirees enroll in a Medicare Advantage plan, often for the wrong reasons. On the surface, Advantage plans have a lot of appeal, but that quickly fades once you learn how your insurance works when you need to use it. In todays video, Marvin Musick shares two stories of people who regretted choosing a Medicare Advantage plan."

programme.title: Understanding the Drawbacks of Medicare Advantage Plans and the Benefits of Supplemental Plans
programme.desc: "Medicare Advantage plans, while popular for their low premiums and additional perks, come with several challenges that can affect patient care and financial stability."

programme.desc: How much can we gain from the mountains? How much can we lose? Between our own perceptions and the reality of the hazards, how much space exists? programme.title: Naayagi Episode 24
programme.desc: Nayagi is a 2018 Indian Tamil-language Family Drama series. It premiered on 19 February 2018 on Sun TV, replacing Deivamagal, and was replaced by Anbe Vaa and it ended on 31 October 2020. The show was produced by Vikatan Televistas Pvt Ltd and directed by S Kumaran. Nayagi was also re-aired on Kalaignar TV from 1 March 2021 and it ended its run on 9 July 2022 Plot Anandhi, a middle-class woman, struggles to keep her life together while dealing with an alcoholic father and his debts. Though her landlady Sargunam is formidable, she wishes to destroy Kalivardhan.
